name: prodeq1
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cprod(s0, c0, c2), cprod(s0, c1, c2)))
bodyPretty: ⊢ (c0 = c1 → prod(s0 ∈ c0, c2)= prod(s0 ∈ c1, c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cprod(s0, c0, c2), cprod(s0, c1, c2)))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| wnfc(s0, c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cprod(s0, c0, c2), cprod(s0, c1, c2)))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| wnfc(s0, c1)

|- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cprod(s0, c0, c2), cprod(s0, c1, c2)))
-| wnfc(s0, c1)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)

|- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cprod(s0, c0, c2), cprod(s0, c1, c2)))
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
-| diffsc(s0, c1)

comment: Equality theorem for a product. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 1-Dec-2017.)
